intro: Liabum silphioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Liabum silphioides is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes known for their nitrogen-fixing abilities.
